item.title: There is a raised paving stone, 3rd February
item.description:
There is a raised paving stone over 1 inch high which I tripped over on 24 January 2025 and fractured my knee. the paving stones between Cranham Road and Princes Street on the right hand side of the road are in an appalling state of repair and clearly have not been maintained for many years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Sydenham Road North, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Existing problem that planned repair won’t fix, 3rd February
item.description:
Ref enquiry 22068997 Your response was: This will be continued to be monitored by our safety Inspection policy, the dropped kerb in question would have been installed by the property owner, they must remain 1m away from the drain and the streetlight, which is why this has been widened further when this would have been installed and can’t be widened any further. This is also due to overriding and parking on the verge, the effect is in for topsoil verge area, but if is driven over this will continue to happen unfortunately. However in response to this I just want some points clarified. You say a drop kerb cannot be 1m away from a drain or street light. As you can see from the picture the drop kerb is already directly adjacent to a drain. No one parks on this area as you suggest, as this would block my drive, but yes overdriving happens on a regular basis because we have to drive over the verge to access our property. The drop kerb is not fit for purpose. If the verge was tarmac’d rather than soiled/seeded this would prevent further erosion. I guarantee soil and seed will be eroded in days. A waste of time and Highways money. Widening the drop kerb by a slight amount would in no way place it any closer to a drain or light than it already is. Please review and contact me to discuss if possible on 07484816659 or email gazlucy@yahoo.co.uk Thank you Gary

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 49, Beeches Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: There is a very big deep pothole in this road, 3rd February
item.description:
There is a very big pothole in Kyderminster Road that is dangerous and needs attending to. There are also a number of significant other holes that also need attending to ASAP. I reported a number of potholes last June and a few were repaired but this road has deteriorated worse than before. Can you give this your urgent attention before a car has an accident hitting this hike or a child hurts themselves crossing the road. Ideally the whole of Kyderminster Road needs resurfacing as does Huddleston Road where the surface is disintegrating
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Huddleston Road, Winchcombe, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Left Behind Signage, 3rd February
item.description:
Previous works carried on out on a faulty manhole were completed but a number of pieces of safety equipment and road signs have been left behind and thrown on the side of the road. There is an additional 2/3 Road signs along the road that have been left. Please can they be collected.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lobleys Drive, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsafe parking when children are travelling to and from school, 3rd February
item.description:
When children are travelling to and from school, cars are parking on the verge, which are blocking the view for vehicles travelling on the Voxwell lane and pulling out of The Highgrove, as well as damaging the grass verge. This has been going on for years.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Voxwell Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Path appears to have been diverted and signs removed, 3rd February
item.description:
The path that used to run directly to the footbridge over the M5 seems to have been shifted as someone has created a new driveway, and the signage seems to have vanished. There are also lots of PRIVATE signs around, which appear to be there to deter anyone venturing along the path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
